item.title: Efficient Barnesâ€“Hut CUDA Simulation
item.description: Intro An N-body simulation is a simulation of a system of n different particles or entities, typically simulating the force of gravity between them. From classic physics, \[F=G\frac{m_1m_2}{r^2}\] where F is force, G is the gravitational constant, \(m_1\) is the mass of object 1, \(m_2\) is the mass of object 2, and \(r\) is the distance between the centers of the two masses. By applying this equation for every pair of entities and accumulating the results, we can calculate the force on every entity at any given point in time.
